alert.note: Alert for Interior Waldo (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 30 at 11:59AM EDT until May 02 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of south central Maine, including the following areas, Coastal Waldo, Interior Waldo, Knox, Lincoln and Sagadahoc. * WHEN...From 8 PM EDT this evening through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Current streamflows are near normal, but excessive rain combined with saturated ground will lead to higher than normal runoff. This may cause river levels to exceed minor flood stage at several locations. Excessive runoff will also coincide with the Monday morning high tide, which will lead to additional concerns with slow drainage.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
